4478458/4391861/4478485.title: To Cure Warts
4478458/4391861/4478485.text:
Get a blade of grass with the knot in the middle of the blade at the year's growth, and roll the blade in brown paper and put it in your pocket. Loose it sometime you don't notice, and by the time the grass withers the wart will be gone.



Get some bran and put it in a tin and heat some until it is quite warm. Get a stocking and put the bran in it and then tie it on your ear and in the morning it will be quite better.
(continues on next page)

4493722/4414130/4527816.text:
Once when a boy had earache, I saw his Mother putting some borax powder on a piece of wadding.  Then she put it in his ears and this cured the pain.



If anyone takes a bleeding of the nose, people sometimes put a wet cloth on their head, and this stops the bleeding.



People also put a piece of white paper on their tongue and this stops the bleeding.

4649689/4647447/4650914.title: A Cure for a Pain in the Ear
4649689/4647447/4650914.text:
An old man named Johnney Bohan Scardawn, told me that the pain in the ear could be cured by roasting an onion in the fire, and putting the heart of it into the ear, while it is warm. Then leaving it in it, for ten minutes, and then the pain will go away.



Corns can be cured in the following way. First get houseleek. Pull it and pound it with a stick. Then rub a piece of butter or lard to it. Put the houseleek on the corn then, by putting a piece of cloth round it. Tie it tightly so that it would not

A cure for a pain in the ear. Get a jug of boiling water and hold your ear over it, and it will ease the pain.



If you have a swollen foot go to the person who makes the cure, and bring a piece of butter without salt. The person says certain prayers, and gives the butter back to you. Then you rub the butter into the swollen part of and keep saying "Glory be to the father, and to the son, and to the holy ghost" till the butter is gone and the swelling will soon reduce.

4742150/4740517/4782075.title: Local Cures - The Thrush
4742150/4740517/4782075.text:
If a child had the thrush outside its mouth or if a grown up person had it in their throat.They should get forge water and gargle their throat with it. If a child had it outside, the forge water is to be poured on to it. This has to be done a few times.A boy who never saw his father has the cure for the thrush. He cures it by breathing into the throat of the person who has it. He blesses himself and says certain prayers also.



If you had an earache you should get the juice from an ash stick when burning. You must put it on a bit of fine cloth and put it in the ear. This should be done a few times and then it will go.

Mr Daly of Ticknevin Carbury Co. Kildare uses a wooden plough.



Dockleaf will cure nettle stingSpit on the dockleaf & rub it on saying"Dockedy dockedy dayTake the sting of the nettle away"



To cure wildfire- Put a black cat up your sleeve and whatever bit of his tale sticks out cut it off and the blood will cure the wild fire.[NB: Wildfire is a skin infection, probably Erysipelas.]



To cure earache- put a piece of black sheep's wool in the ear.

4798675/4789333/4892120.title: A Cough
4798675/4789333/4892120.text:
Boil the roots of garlic for two hours on milk or water and drink a spoonful or two fasting.



Ear ache.Take an onion and roast it and squeeze the juice on to a bit of wool or drop a little of it into the ear. Put in the wool with the onion juice. The pain will be instantly relieved.Toothache.Boil the first egg laid by a black pullet and eat it. The pain goes.



Toothache.Boil the first egg laid by a black pullet and eat it. The pain goes.

4742084/4734321/4923448.title: Scéal i dtaobh Fear a Fuair Bás agus Ní Chaitheadh Aoinne a Éadaí
4742084/4734321/4923448.text:
Bi fear i BunAtha fado. Tadhg Mor a b'anam do. Nuair a fuair se bas nior caitheamh aoinne a eudaig. Bhi se marbh tri seachtain deug. Cuaidh a mach amach aon oidhche agus connach se a athar in a suidhe ar carraig in aice an tighe. Cuaidh se isteach aris, agus dinnis  se an sgeal da mhathair.Cuaidh se amach aris an oidhche na dhiaidh sin, agus chonnaich se e aris. Dubhairt se leis a mhathair an dara oidhche go raibh a athair ar an gcarraigh ceudna, agus na raibh aon eudaigh air. Bhiodh se san ait ceudna, agus sa slighe ceudna leis. Cuimnigh siad nar caitheamh aoinne a euduig. An ceud Domnach a thainig do caitheamh an mach na heudaig. Ni fheaca aoinne se o shoin i leith.



Olladh chaoire dubh do chuir isteach san cluais agus dul a coladh.

4769976/4763660/4929034.title: Ailments and Cures - Cure for Earache
4769976/4763660/4929034.text:
Get a drop of olive-oil and a piece of wadding. Put the olive-oil upon the wadding and put it into the ear and the pain will go away. Every one does this around here for a pain in the ear.



Get a Gooseberry thorn. Point it at the sty three times. Then make the sign of the cross and throw the thorn over your right shoulder and do not look for the thorn. You have only to do this once to cure the sty. My Father told me this cure and I did it and it cured the sty.

4922085/4850895/4946404.title: Local Cures - Cure for Burns
4922085/4850895/4946404.text:
(continued from previous page)
Local Cures (Contd)If your leg is burned shake flour on the leg and it will never blister.  (Patrick Blackwell)If you get a burn of a nettle pluck a dog-leaf and wrap the dog leaf around it for a while (Joe Ryan)



Put a grain of lime into your tooth and it will kill the nerve Put cold water into your mouth and keep it in until it gets hot then put a grain of lime into it. Mix salt and water together and take a sup of it and leave it in your mouth for a while and then spit it out.



Bathe it with hot water to clean it out and then put oil in it



Cure for BoilsWhen you get a boil get a piece of wax and warm it to the fire and stick it to the boil (Michael Keating)A cure for boils, is to get snails and bruise them together and then put the snails to the boils and it will cure them (Con Kemp)

4770004/4766051/4956514.title: Cures in Olden Times - Burns
4770004/4766051/4956514.text:
An egg was broken, and the skin which lies beside the shell was put on burns. A cabbage leaf was roasted on an iron pot lid, this leaf was put on burns also.Laurel leaves fried with lard and put on burns was though a great cure.



Brown paper was steeped in vinegar, and placed upon the head for a headache.Duck weed reduces information, and St Anthony's Fire. The fresh herb applied to the forehead relieves headaches.



For an earache:- an onion was roasted, and past of it put into the ear.



For a child suffering with worms: - three drops of turpentine were put on a lump sugar, this was given to the child to eat.



For a child smothering :- a tallow candle was melted and rubbed into the child's chest.



Buttermilk and breadsoda were brought to a paste, and rubbled into hives.

4922210/4860887/5016002.text:
Pain in the BackJurpentine sprinkled on red flannel and applied to the back



LumbagoA mixture of salt and mustard on red flannel



Sore throatWell heated salt in a woollen stocking which is tied round the throat on retiring to bed



A cold1. An onion is boiled in a pint of new milk and drunk as hot as possible. The patient must remain in bed for a day or two2. Bathe the feet in hot water and mustard



Ear-acheA piece of cotton wool steeped in hot olive oil placed in the ear gives relief2. Hold the ear over the stream of a jug of boiling water3. Squeeze a portion of a cut onion, and allow a few drops of the juice into the ear.4. The centre of an onion heated at the fire and inserted in the ear.

4922271/4866157/5072121.title: Cures - Burn
4922271/4866157/5072121.text:
I heard the following cure for a burn. Get a peice of hog's lard and a laurel leaf. Cut both  of them up very small and fry them together and when they are fried rub them to the burn for a while. Repeat this until the burn is cured. Another cure is olive oil, lime and water mixed together and then rubbed to it.



This is the cure for chillblains. The cure can be obtained before they break out. Pick a puca and rub it to the chillblains. A puca is like a dew and is full of dust. The dust cures the chillblains.



I heard the following cure for an ear ache. Go to a person who is smoking a pipe and get him to blow the smoke into the ear. This is supposed to be a good cure.



The following is a cure for a bee sting. Bluestone for spraying potatoes is to be rubbed on dry. If it falls off it should be repeated for a few times.

4922384/4876331/5080411.text:

A posthumous child is believed to be gifted with the power of curing this disease.  The person effecting the cure is supposed to touch or lick the tongue of the sufferer.If the parent of a suffering child meets any man with a white horse, and asks him for a cure, whatever the horseman recommends will succeed.



The family of "Cassidy" (each and every one of the name) is supposed to be able to cure any malady arising from, or caused by, worms (in persons or animals).The story is told of a man named Cassidy who was at a "meihull" and some one of the company denied or doubted the power which he was supposed to possess.Cassidy took him (the doubter) to hole in the field where they found a worm of some kind under water. A cure for a pain in the earIf you have no olive oil, melt some butter and put it on a piece of wadding and put it into the ear.Shiela Fullam

"Maurteen" causes hacks. To cure them melt pitch and cover the hacks with it when they "close" the pitch will fall off.



Burn an old boot, mix the ashes with butter and rub on bald spot. This makes the hair grow again.



Roast blessed salt and put to ear in cloth.



Peter said upon a marble stone Jesus came to him alone and said "What ails thee, Peter? Peter said "O, Lord my tooth doth ache". Our Lord said "Arise Peter and come with Me  King of Nazareth, King of the Jews.

Let this juice cool and drop it into the ear.To roll an onion in several layers of wet brown paper and roast in open fire and when soft squeeze out of the onion and let the juice cool and drop into ear for earache.



Roast a black snail in wet brown paper and apply to a corn.



Put the raw white of an egg over any cut and it will prevent a scar.

5008995/4974969/5112897.title: Remedy for Earache
5008995/4974969/5112897.text:
The juice which comes from a piece of green ash timber when burning in the fire is supposed to be a cure for ear-ache. It should be poured when cool into the affected ear.



Old people say that if you have rheumatism you should beat yourself well with nettles and it will cure you.



There is an old well in Wilkinstown bog called Emlagh well. The water of the well was supposed to be a cure for stomach trouble and also to be a certain means of giving a good appetite to the person drinking it.

5009007/4976420/5115458.title: Local Cures - A Cure for Warts
5009007/4976420/5115458.text:
If you come across a black snail when not looking for one, rub it to the warts and then stick it on a thorn. as the snail withers on the thorn the warts will disappear.



When an ash stick is in the fire, the end farthest from the fire steams and sap oozes out of it. Take this sap on a spoon and pour it into the ear that is sore and it will cure the pain.

5009089/4985530/5121561.title: Cures - A Cure for Warts
5009089/4985530/5121561.text:
The following cures are held locally.  A cure for warts.  Tie a horse's hair around the wart and in a few days it withers away.  Miss Fagan, Streete, Co. Westmeath told it to me.  She is about fifty years of age.



A cure for an ear ache.  Boil the Cameline Daisy and drop the juice of it into your ear three times each day and after four or five days it (withers away) goes away.  Michael Mullan, Ballyvade, Bunbrosna, Co. Westmeath.  He is about sixty years of age.



Cure for ring-worm.  The seventh son Thomas Browne, Donore, Multyfarnham, Co. Westmeath has the cure of ring-worm.  When he puts his tumb to it it goes away in a day.



Cure for a cow with sore spins.  Boil elder leaves and dab the juice on her spins.  James Mac Loughlin, Ballyvade, Bunbrosna, Co. Westmeath.  He is seventy eight years of age.

5162105/5154757/5200466.title: A Cure for a Pain in Your Ear
5162105/5154757/5200466.text:
First get an onion and roast it. When it is roasted, peel it and put the heart of the onion in cotton-wool. Then put castor-oil on the wool, and put this on the person's ear, as hot as he can bear it. Do this for three night's in succession and the pain will go away.



A cure for whooping cough is to ask the first man you see  riding a white horse what cure he advises you to give. You give whatever he suggests to the person who has the whooping cough and the person will get better. Another cure for whooping cough is to ask any two married people of the woman's maiden name for a cure, and whatever they say to give, give it to the person and the person will get better.
